definition: to store up/to grow (e.g. a beard)/to entertain (ideas)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Police believe the family was targeted when the father was at work.
sentences.chinese: 警察相信是當父親外出工作時，他們被蓄意謀殺的。

sentences.english: One of the things that concerns me is the rise in vandalism.
sentences.chinese: 令我擔憂的問題之一是蓄意破壞案件的上升。

sentences.english: The ellipsis is the punctuation mark (…) that indicates an intentional omission.
sentences.chinese: 省略號表示的是作者蓄意的省略。

sentences.english: Mr Souza said the claims were smear attempts.
sentences.chinese: 索薩先生說所有指控都是蓄意誹謗。

sentences.english: Yet the attacks were meant to murder.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這兩起汽車炸彈襲擊蓄意謀殺。

sentences.english: I'm not doing this deliberately, please believe me.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有蓄意去做此事，請相信我。

sentences.english: The Deputy Commander has condemned this weekend's protest as deliberate provocation.
sentences.chinese: 副指揮官譴責本週末的抗議活動是蓄意挑釁。

sentences.english: I realized then that someone had killed them.
sentences.chinese: 我意識到是某些人蓄意謀殺了他們。

sentences.english: Is Li Xiang's job-hopping true or speculation?
sentences.chinese: 李湘跳槽副臺長蓄意炒作還是真有其事？

sentences.english: Be honest but not intentionally hurtful.
sentences.chinese: 儘量誠實但不要蓄意傷害。

sentences.english: Obstructionism is generally most evident at the stage of implementing a law.
sentences.chinese: 在執行法案時通常最常見的就是蓄意阻撓。

sentences.english: Saddam to set an army of ex-prisoners against Washington's saboteurs.
sentences.chinese: 薩達姆大羣的獲釋囚徒對抗華盛頓派遣的蓄意破壞者。

sentences.english: Frick recovered; Berkman served 14 years in prison for attempted murder.
sentences.chinese: Berkman以蓄意謀殺罪在監獄裏呆了14年。

sentences.english: It is against federal law to knowingly and willfully disclose or transmit classified information.
sentences.chinese: 蓄意公開或者傳播機密信息將違反聯邦法律。

sentences.english: Because he set fire to a house and tried to fired at me.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他放火燒了一棟房子並且蓄意向我開槍。

sentences.english: After being rebuilt, the orphanage was set on fire a second time that same year.
sentences.chinese: 孤兒院重建之後，又在同一年再次被蓄意縱火。

definition: to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]
to start rumours and create trouble
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
premeditated/to plan sth in advance (esp. a crime)
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
